meanings.definition: A follower or student of a teacher, leader, or philosophy.
meanings.sent1: The young boy was a dedicated disciple of his karate instructor.
meanings.sent2: The disciples of the wise old monk gathered around to listen to his teachings.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy was a disciple of chaos, always causing mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a sanctuary for the disciples of nature, blooming with life.
meanings.sent5: The artist's studio was filled with eager disciples, ready to learn and create.

meanings.definition: One of the twelve personal followers of Jesus.
meanings.sent1: In the Bible, Peter was one of the most well-known disciples of Jesus.
meanings.sent2: The disciples followed Jesus as he preached his message of love and forgiveness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel acted like a disciple of Jesus, spreading joy wherever it went.
meanings.sent4: The city streets echoed with the footsteps of the disciples, spreading the word of their teacher.
meanings.sent5: The disciples of Jesus gathered by the shore, listening to his parables with awe.
